unit_learning_outcomes.description: Explore and critically evaluate the theoretical underpinnings of performance and reward strategies, applying this theoretical knowledge to solve problems and develop outcomes relating to performance and reward systems within a number of organisational contexts.
Identify and apply the different approaches to managing performance and reward systems in contemporary organisations.

Evaluate and communicate the strategic value that performance and reward strategy contribute to the holistic development of contemporary Human Resource Management (HRM) systems in support of delivering organisational goals.
Critically analyse and compare contemporary performance and rewards strategies to identify their strengths, weaknesses and impact on stakeholders and organisational performance.

assessments.description: A two-hour online examination, administered via iLearn and worth 20%, will be held during the University Examination Period.

This assessment consists of two components worth 40% in total. The first component is a group presentation of 3 minutes per group member worth 20%. The second component is an individual report of up to 1,200 words worth 20%.
An individual case study of up to 2,000 words worth 30%.
A 2 hour final examination worth 20% will be held during the University Examination Period.

data.description: This unit examines the role of remuneration and performance management systems in contemporary organisations. Utilising theory and practical examples, the unit will enable students to identify the essential elements required to design a comprehensive remuneration and performance management system that delivers strategic value to a range of stakeholders, including the organisation and workers. Problem solving skills will be emphasised.
